title: Just... don't.
body:
Feel like banning that champion your teammate has declared because you lolnexused their account and you think they're terrible?

Feel like banning that Champion your teammate declared _exclusively_ because someone played bad as that Champion in your last match?

Do you want to run it down mid and intentionally feed your ass off because some schmuck banned your favorite champion?

Got the urge to rage and spew filth from the orifice that is your mouth because your bottom lane keeps feeding?

Ever feel like going afk just because the first 5 minutes of the game didn't go your way?

-------------

**Just... don't!**

It's a really simple concept, and your account and teammates will love you all the more for it. You won't get banned, you won't get chat restrictions. A little bit of self control can go a long way. 

Remember, just because those other 9 players have no idea who you are in real life, it doesn't make it any less hurtful. 

_This message brought to you by the COGS (Coalition of Good Sportsmanship)_

Good luck out there on the Rift!

I still ban LeBlanc because I had a 100% loss rate against her last season.

I played like 27 games with and against LeBlanc. Lost every single one of them exclusively because of the LeBlanc player. I'm talking 27/0 enemy team 0/27 my team.

Here's the thing though - banning your teammates' Champions for any reason will more than likely make them play poorly, inadvertently making it easier to lose when that's not your goal.

And that's not even taking into account the possible direct reactions to having their pick intent banned. Some people will go out of their way to make the match hell for you because you banned their Champion, doing everything from flaming, intentionally feeding, trolling, and anything in between.

So, I reiterate; for your own sake, if no one else's - don't ban your teammate's pick intent.

I have banned my teammates intended pick before.  It's certainly your right to do it, Riot has stated that you can do as you wish with your ban.  If I see you're locking in Sivir and you went 0/16 with her the last 5 games you played, then yeah, I'll ban her.  

> Feel like banning that Champion your teammate declared _exclusively_ because someone played bad as that Champion in your last match?

My reasons for banning the champion are irrelevant, I'll ban a champ if I so chose.  Perhaps I don't want to face them, maybe they're a contested pick or perhaps I just want to play a game without seeing a Thresh for a change.  
 
> Do you want to run it down mid and intentionally feed your ass off because some schmuck banned your favorite champion?

This is actually reportable/punishable, banning your teammate's intended pick is not.  

> Got the urge to rage and spew filth from the orifice that is your mouth because your bottom lane keeps feeding?

Again, this is reportable/punishable, banning your teammate's intended pick is not.

> Ever feel like going afk just because the first 5 minutes of the game didn&#039;t go your way?

You can "feel like" doing whatever you want, what you actually do with those feelings is what speaks volumes.  If you afk, that's reportable, if you feel like doing it but don't actually do it then that's just fine.  

Please stop trying to dictate what I can and cannot do with my ban, it comes across as self-righteous and patronizing.
